page.title: 12RECREATION IN AREA
page.content: The only outdoor sports facility in the area is the Flyford Flavell cricket field, loaned to the Club by Mr.James Taylor a local farmer. Cricket, on a wicket of dubious character, takes place there on most weekends.There is a small pavilion but tea is hopefully taken outside, often with cider provided by the local inn. The major occupation is obviously gardening with many local people having fine traditional gardens. Many farmers and their children are keen on horse riding and there is a strong hunting presence in the area. There being virtually no public facilities, most local people wanting to participate in or watch sporting activities find it necessary to travel to local towns. A few locals have their own tennis courts or swimming pools.
